ref: 9919 maṣati ʻ *rubs, crushes ʼ (ʻ hurts ʼ Dhātup.). [Cf. maṣaṁ (v.l. ˚ṣiṁ) kārayati ʻ grinds to powder ʼ ŚāṅkhGr̥., maṣmaṣāˊkarōti AV., masmasāˊ -- TS. ŚBr., mr̥smr̥sāˊ˚ MS. (EWA ii 604 of onom. origin rather than with J. Bloch BSOS v 741 ← Drav., Kan. masagu ʻ to rub ʼ &c., in DED 3779). K. with -- h -- indicates earlier -- ṣ -- or -- ś -- , which would allow collision with mr̥śáti ʻ grasps, seizes ʼ AV. (Pa. only in cmpds. āmasati, parimasati) as the origin. Prob. in MIA. onom.(?) maṣ -- and maś -- (< mr̥śáti) collided, and were further influenced by Drav. forms. The variety of extensions in the NIA. verbs indicates their popular character and possible non -- Aryan influences]
A. masiba ʻ to wipe, plaster ʼ (lw. with -- s -- or < *macyatē?). -- Ext. -- kk -- :
P. maskaṇā ʻ to press, be torn ʼ
Ku.; maskauṇo ʻ to press, squeeze ʼ;
N. maskanu, ˚kinu ʻ to be tightened ʼ, maskāunu ʻ to tighten, scour ʼ, masakka ʻ tightly ʼ;
H. masaknā ʻ to touch, stroke, rub, squeeze ʼ, maskānā ʻ to press, squeeze ʼ; -- -- r -- :
Pk. masāra -- m. ʻ stone for grinding on ʼ, masarakkaï ʻ is tightened ʼ;
K. mahārun ʻ to separate by rubbing in the hand, crumble ʼ;
N. musārnu, mas˚ ʻ to touch, stroke ʼ;
A. mohāriba ʻ to crush, squeeze ʼ; -- -- l -- :
G. masaḷvũ ʻ to rub, crumble, knead, shampoo ʼ; -- -- ll -- :
P. masalṇā ʻ to bruise, crush ʼ;
Or. masalibā ʻ to wrench, twist ʼ;
H. masalnā ʻ to rub to pieces ʼ; -- -- ṭṭ -- :
A. mahaṭiyāiba ʻ to crush by treading down ʼ. -- X márdati:
M. masãdṇẽ, masãdaḷṇẽ ʻ to knead and squeeze, crush together ʼ. --
Or. masmas ʻ rustling sound ʼ, masmasiā ʻ crumbly, crisp ʼ are certainly onom.
